alert.note: Alert for Hendricks; Johnson; Marion; Morgan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Morgan, western Johnson, southeastern Hendricks and southwestern Marion Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 745 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mooresville, or 22 miles southwest of Indianapolis, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mooresville around 750 AM EDT. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 57 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
